overview.description: A comprehensive, hands-on introduction to using the Grok API for building AI-powered applications. Learn how to authenticate, make API calls, handle responses, and integrate Grok into your Python projects. Each lesson includes practical examples, micro-exercises, and real-world use cases.
overview.target_audience: Beginners who know basic Python and want to integrate Grok AI capabilities into their applications.
prerequisites: Basic Python knowledge (variables, functions, HTTP requests)
Familiarity with REST APIs (helpful but not required)

modules.title: Getting Started with Grok API
modules.description: Introduction to the Grok API, its capabilities, and how to set up your environment.

lessons.title: Introduction to Grok API
lessons.summary: Learn what Grok API is and its potential applications.

hands_on_labs.title: Exploring Grok API Documentation
hands_on_labs.goal: Navigate the Grok API documentation to understand its endpoints and capabilities.

micro_exercises.title: Identify API Use Cases
micro_exercises.task: List three potential applications of the Grok API in real-world scenarios.

micro_exercises.title: API Terminology Quiz
micro_exercises.task: Match API terms with their definitions using a provided list.

knowledge_check.question: What is an API?
knowledge_check.answer: An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software applications to communicate with each other.

knowledge_check.question: What are common HTTP methods used in APIs?
knowledge_check.answer: Common HTTP methods include GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE.

lessons.title: Setting Up Your Python Environment
lessons.summary: Learn how to set up your Python environment for working with the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Create a Virtual Environment
hands_on_labs.goal: Set up a virtual environment for your Grok API project.

micro_exercises.title: Verify Python Installation
micro_exercises.task: Run a command to check if Python is installed correctly.

micro_exercises.title: Create a Virtual Environment
micro_exercises.task: Use the command line to create a virtual environment for your project.

knowledge_check.question: Why use a virtual environment?
knowledge_check.answer: A virtual environment allows you to manage dependencies for different projects separately.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to install libraries in Python?
knowledge_check.answer: The command 'pip install library_name' is used to install libraries.

lessons.title: Making Your First API Call
lessons.summary: Learn how to make your first API call to the Grok API and handle the response.

hands_on_labs.title: Fetch Data from Grok API
hands_on_labs.goal: Make a GET request to the Grok API and display the response.

micro_exercises.title: Make a GET Request
micro_exercises.task: Write a Python script to make a GET request to a sample endpoint.

micro_exercises.title: Parse JSON Response
micro_exercises.task: Extract specific data from the JSON response and print it.

knowledge_check.question: What is a GET request?
knowledge_check.answer: A GET request is used to retrieve data from a specified resource.

knowledge_check.question: What does a status code of 200 indicate?
knowledge_check.answer: A status code of 200 indicates that the request was successful.

modules.title: Working with Grok API Endpoints
modules.description: Explore various endpoints of the Grok API and learn how to interact with them.

lessons.title: Exploring Grok API Endpoints
lessons.summary: Learn about the different endpoints available in the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Navigate Grok API Endpoints
hands_on_labs.goal: Explore the Grok API documentation to identify key endpoints.

micro_exercises.title: List Key Endpoints
micro_exercises.task: Create a list of key endpoints and their functionalities.

micro_exercises.title: Endpoint Functionality Quiz
micro_exercises.task: Answer questions about the functionalities of different endpoints.

knowledge_check.question: What is an endpoint?
knowledge_check.answer: An endpoint is a specific URL where an API can be accessed to perform operations.

knowledge_check.question: What is the difference between GET and POST endpoints?
knowledge_check.answer: GET endpoints retrieve data, while POST endpoints send data to the server.

lessons.title: Making POST Requests
lessons.summary: Learn how to make POST requests to send data to the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Submit Data to Grok API
hands_on_labs.goal: Make a POST request to submit data to a Grok API endpoint.

micro_exercises.title: Create a JSON Payload
micro_exercises.task: Write a JSON payload to send in a POST request.

micro_exercises.title: Handle POST Response
micro_exercises.task: Write code to handle the response from a POST request.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of a POST request?
knowledge_check.answer: A POST request is used to send data to a server to create or update a resource.

knowledge_check.question: How do you format data for a POST request?
knowledge_check.answer: Data for a POST request should be formatted as JSON.

lessons.title: Handling API Responses
lessons.summary: Learn how to effectively handle responses from the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Handle API Response
hands_on_labs.goal: Write code to handle and display data from an API response.

micro_exercises.title: Parse JSON Data
micro_exercises.task: Extract specific fields from a JSON response and print them.

micro_exercises.title: Error Handling Exercise
micro_exercises.task: Write code to handle potential errors from an API call.

knowledge_check.question: What is JSON?
knowledge_check.answer: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write.

knowledge_check.question: What should you do if an API call fails?
knowledge_check.answer: You should check the error message and status code to understand the issue.

modules.title: Error Handling and Rate Limiting
modules.description: Learn how to handle errors and implement rate limiting when working with the Grok API.

lessons.title: Understanding API Errors
lessons.summary: Learn about common API errors and how to handle them.

hands_on_labs.title: Implement Error Handling
hands_on_labs.goal: Write code to handle common API errors and log them.

micro_exercises.title: Identify API Errors
micro_exercises.task: List common API errors and their meanings.

micro_exercises.title: Error Handling Code
micro_exercises.task: Write a function to handle a specific API error.

knowledge_check.question: What does a 404 error indicate?
knowledge_check.answer: A 404 error indicates that the requested resource was not found.

knowledge_check.question: Why is error logging important?
knowledge_check.answer: Error logging helps in debugging and maintaining the application.

lessons.title: Implementing Rate Limiting
lessons.summary: Learn how to implement rate limiting to manage API call frequency.

hands_on_labs.title: Manage API Call Frequency
hands_on_labs.goal: Write code to implement rate limiting for API calls.

micro_exercises.title: Rate Limiting Scenarios
micro_exercises.task: Identify scenarios where rate limiting is necessary.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Rate Limiting
micro_exercises.task: Write code to handle rate limit errors.

knowledge_check.question: What is rate limiting?
knowledge_check.answer: Rate limiting is a technique used to control the amount of incoming requests to a server.

knowledge_check.question: What happens when you exceed the rate limit?
knowledge_check.answer: Exceeding the rate limit usually results in receiving a 429 Too Many Requests error.

lessons.title: Best Practices for API Usage
lessons.summary: Learn best practices for using APIs effectively and efficiently.

hands_on_labs.title: Optimize API Usage
hands_on_labs.goal: Review and optimize existing API calls in your project.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Best Practices
micro_exercises.task: List best practices for API usage.

micro_exercises.title: Optimize API Call
micro_exercises.task: Refactor an API call to improve efficiency.

knowledge_check.question: What is a best practice for API usage?
knowledge_check.answer: A best practice is to minimize the number of API calls by caching responses.

knowledge_check.question: Why is error handling important?
knowledge_check.answer: Error handling is crucial for maintaining application stability and user experience.

modules.title: Building a Complete Application with Grok API
modules.description: Integrate all learned concepts to build a complete application using the Grok API.

lessons.title: Planning Your Application
lessons.summary: Learn how to plan your application architecture and features.

hands_on_labs.title: Create an Application Plan
hands_on_labs.goal: Draft a plan outlining your application's features and architecture.

micro_exercises.title: Define User Stories
micro_exercises.task: Write user stories for your application.

micro_exercises.title: Feature Prioritization Exercise
micro_exercises.task: Prioritize features based on user needs.

knowledge_check.question: What is a user story?
knowledge_check.answer: A user story is a short description of a feature from the perspective of the user.

knowledge_check.question: Why is feature prioritization important?
knowledge_check.answer: Feature prioritization helps focus development on the most valuable features.

lessons.title: Developing the Application
lessons.summary: Learn how to develop the application using the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Build Application Features
hands_on_labs.goal: Develop and integrate features into your application.

micro_exercises.title: Implement a Feature
micro_exercises.task: Write code to implement a specific feature of your application.

micro_exercises.title: Test Application Functionality
micro_exercises.task: Run tests to ensure all features work as expected.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of testing?
knowledge_check.answer: Testing ensures that the application functions correctly and meets requirements.

knowledge_check.question: How do you integrate API calls?
knowledge_check.answer: API calls are integrated by writing code that sends requests to the API and handles responses.

lessons.title: Deploying Your Application
lessons.summary: Learn how to deploy your application for public access.

hands_on_labs.title: Deploy Your Application
hands_on_labs.goal: Deploy your application to a chosen hosting platform.

micro_exercises.title: Choose a Hosting Platform
micro_exercises.task: Research and select a suitable hosting platform for your application.

micro_exercises.title: Prepare for Deployment
micro_exercises.task: List steps needed to prepare your application for deployment.

knowledge_check.question: What is the deployment process?
knowledge_check.answer: The deployment process involves preparing the application and making it accessible to users.

knowledge_check.question: Why is testing important before deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: Testing ensures that the application is functioning correctly and is free of critical bugs.

real_world_use_cases: Making your application available to users

modules.title: Capstone Project
modules.description: Integrate all learned concepts to build a complete application using the Grok API.

lessons.title: Capstone Project Overview
lessons.summary: Overview of the capstone project requirements and expectations.

hands_on_labs.title: Draft Project Plan
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a project plan outlining features and timeline.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Project Features
micro_exercises.task: List features to include in your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Create a Project Timeline
micro_exercises.task: Draft a timeline for completing your project.

knowledge_check.question: What are the key components of a project plan?
knowledge_check.answer: Key components include project requirements, timeline, and resources.

knowledge_check.question: Why is planning important?
knowledge_check.answer: Planning helps ensure that the project is completed on time and meets requirements.

real_world_use_cases: Applying learned skills to a real project

lessons.title: Building the Capstone Project
lessons.summary: Develop the capstone project using the Grok API.

hands_on_labs.title: Develop Capstone Features
hands_on_labs.goal: Build and integrate features into your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Implement a Feature
micro_exercises.task: Write code to implement a specific feature of your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Test Project Functionality
micro_exercises.task: Run tests to ensure all features work as expected.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of testing?
knowledge_check.answer: Testing ensures that the project functions correctly and meets requirements.

knowledge_check.question: How do you integrate API calls?
knowledge_check.answer: API calls are integrated by writing code that sends requests to the API and handles responses.

lessons.title: Presenting the Capstone Project
lessons.summary: Learn how to present your capstone project effectively.

hands_on_labs.title: Prepare Presentation
hands_on_labs.goal: Create materials for presenting your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Draft Presentation Outline
micro_exercises.task: Create an outline for your project presentation.

micro_exercises.title: Practice Presentation Delivery
micro_exercises.task: Rehearse your presentation in front of a peer.

knowledge_check.question: What are key components of a project presentation?
knowledge_check.answer: Key components include project overview, demonstration, and feedback gathering.

knowledge_check.question: Why is audience engagement important?
knowledge_check.answer: Audience engagement helps ensure that your message is effectively communicated.

capstone.title: Capstone Project
capstone.description: Integrate all learned concepts to build a complete application using the Grok API.
